reviewText: I love this title even though the second to the last episode was predictable and felt lazy.I wished I had a chance to ask Urobuchi sensei at AX what happened thereThe audio is not the same when I switch from japanese to the ADR version which is the reason for th 4 stars.I rewatched the first episode and Its becoming clearer that something is off with the ADR for Akane .And about the Japanese seiyuu  Kana , I had a problem with her being chosen becuase she has a very sweet cute voice. But her performance is very natural and good in my ears aince I can understand her. .In the mean time , our ADR talent especially in episode 2, her work sounded very forced. Her attitude is coming out really different from the attitude of the Japanese seiyuu's work. But I guess if you havent watched the Japanese version , it may not make any difference however as a voice actor , I have a problem with it.I just hope I get use to her delivery.On the other hand ,  the other voice actors are pretty  good.
summary: I love this title even though the second to the last ...

reviewText: My review of part one stands here as well. This is one of the best anime programs I have ever enjoyed. A "Ghost In The Shell" flavor with stunning blu-ray animation and great music. A future crime fighting theme that makes sense and keeps you on the edge of your seat. If you, like me, are sick of giant robots and squeaky young girls then this is your cup of tea.

reviewText: After the insane ending of part 1, I couldn't wait to watch part 2. Suffice to say that while 1 was on a personal level, 2 takes things to a massive, epidemic scale.The animation is sheer eye-candy, including an intense knife combat scene. The writing continually amazes, and I have to give real credit to the English voice actors who truly brought this show to life.I can't wait for more.

reviewText: Absolutely wonderful story, great completion of the story, once your fully engaged into the mix this second part literally just takes hold and steers you home. The characrers really open uo and you feel as though your really in the story.
Title: N/A

reviewText: After what seems to be an origin story episode Part 2 continues where Part 1 left off, and the impact of the events that transpired shape and guide the rest of this story and particularly the characters development.  The pacing really just gets faster and more brutal all the way to the last episode, which left me without words.There isnt much to say if your already here, but the overall plot is extremely complicated at this point and the moral standpoint of the characters starts to get kindof confusing, but in an extremely good way.  The ending does have a finality to it and seems to settle some of the moral dispute, but it also perfectly plants the seeds for a new season which i just cant wait to watch!Also, this second part has 2 really well animated fight scenes which are some of the best ive ever seen, seriously.  It also has one of the best opening themes ive ever heard and has some pretty good english voice actors.This is now one of my favorite shows and definately the best anime thats come out in the past 3 years in my opinion, and if your by any chance here without having watched Part 1, go read my review of that and WATCH IT.  And please, if anyone has other shows they can suggest to me I would love to hear it cuz im running out of stuff to watch!

reviewText: After watching how part one ended I didn't think Psycho-Pass could make me feel the same tension from episode eleven. Well they did and it was an amazing ride. If you have already seen the first part you aren't even reading this anyway...odds are you have already bought it. If you haven't...you should.

reviewText: You may be wondering why the first season is split into two parts. Well this first Season is Just as Long episode wise as the modern and current animes. Anyways BUy Both you won't regret it :) This is a quick Pros and Cons ReviewPros-Made by the Creators of Ghost in the Shell-Fantastic Animation, Absolutely solid work-Story based mini arcs that lead to great ending that can't be missed by any anime fan:)-The main characters both Male Shinya Kōgami Enforcer, Female Akane Tsunemori Detective, And! Best Villain I have seen in a long time Anime wise Shōgo Makishima!! Also Male lol- If you like Futuristic Society/Action/Detective work/Fantastic Melee combat/Freakin Sweet Dominator Guns/ and a Series that Messes with your sense of Morality and what you think a Society Should be well then.........Your in the Right Place! despite all these weirdos complaining about anime getting shorter Your getting your moneys worth with ever episode the plat gets thicker and more intriguing,-You will have an absolute Blast with this anime if you want something Fresh and well Directed/ProducedCons-You have to wait for the Second Season this coming October Followed By a Movie as well!!!!!!!!!
summary: A New Classic to add to your collection. Thats just getting Started!

reviewText: This is definitely an underrated series (for now), and I wish more people would see it. If you liked Ghost in a Shell and those criminal investigation shows like NCIS, CSI etc... There's a chance you will like Psycho-Pass. Most of the characters are well developed, and the animation is great! Plot and story are also great, with (in my opinion) a really good dub. Part 2 comes with episodes 12 to 22, but it doesn't really have a lot of extras... The extras it does have are Commentaries, Textless opening and ending, trailers, and Psycho Pass at Sakura-Con Part 2. Overall, I'm satisfied with this purchase, and I would recommend it to anyone who likes anime!I uploaded some pics, incase you are interested, they should be on the customer images, section... :)
summary: One of my favorite anime series.
Title: N/A

reviewText: With the second set we see more of the seemingly insidious plans of the young sociopath though with the current system rating view an upstanding citizen named  Shogo Makishima and his followers. As you watch the series though it's done well where you can actually connect somewhat to Shogo's plight though not his actions as he sees the Sybyl system for what it is, a flawed construct that soft leashes humanity with rules and regulations but seems to take away any form of true free individuality and their own sense of self worth as the populace has been lulled by the systems seemingly peaceful and regulated ways.While a little shorter then some of the other series it's worth taking a look into just a little notice though since this is based on a manga series the ending is left open so while the final episode won't leave you disappointed majorly it's still a little annoying.
summary: The Final Question Of Morality, Should It Fall On Others To Impose And Validate Or The Individual?

reviewText: Innovative. Phillip K Dickian. You can't beat it. We need more anime like this  interesting, thought provoking. Not rehashed, take every famous anime and smash it together *coughGULITYSWORDcough* or retarded harem shows all about fan service, static characters, and no plot and sure shows about NEETs can be funny (Im getting really sick of all the eroge video novels getting tuned into anime - when their story doesn't merit it on iota (not sure if these were all games beforehand but stuff like SAMURAI GIRLS for example or better yet Ikki Tousen, Sekeri etc etc)  -When there is so much AMAZING stuff left to translate (or that can be translated, why bother with crap like Cat Planet Cuties, and The World Only God Knows, Or KissxSis - really? Did that warrant a dub?) The Future Diary, Chaos;Head, Steins; Gate, Robotics; Notes,\howe ver - Fate/Stay Night on the other hand, When They Cry, and the lik are amazing - like Welcome To the NHK! or This reminded me of a cop oriented max headroom almost (but, im watching Max Headroom ATM so it could just be biased to say that) both futuristic dystopian cyber-punk aesthetics - with episodic nature but an over  arching plot aswell. Fantastic series. The Bar has been raised ANIME INDUSTRY - I expect you to follow suit.
summary: One of the greatest animes in years
